column4: I'm not positive but I think not having a menu probably means the grub menu.lst didn't get created.  But I'm not sure where that happens during the installation.
I would probably try to install again, and try to take good notes in case the install fails again
stories like that are one reason I haven't bought a laptop yet
and d00by: I have too many other problems with that laptop. Never buy toshiba satellites (specifically the a70).
